member.name: USAGE_PROPERTIES
member.summary: Contains device properties (Human Interface Device (HID) global items that correspond to HID usages) for any type of HID input device.

member.name: USAGE_PROPERTIES.level
member.summary: A usage-specific value for a range-based linear control (knob or dial), an on/off control (toggle switch), a momentary control (mouse button), a one-shot control (button that triggers a single event), or re-trigger control (button that triggers a repeating event).

member.name: USAGE_PROPERTIES.page
member.summary: The Usage Page ID, such as VR Controls Page (0x03) or Game Controls Page (0x05).

member.name: USAGE_PROPERTIES.usage
member.summary: The Usage ID associated with a Usage Page, such as Turn Right/Left (21) or Move Right/Left (24) for a Game Controls Page.

member.name: USAGE_PROPERTIES.logicalMinimum
member.summary: The smallest value that the control can report.

member.name: USAGE_PROPERTIES.logicalMaximum
member.summary: The largest value that the control can report.

member.name: USAGE_PROPERTIES.unit
member.summary: The standard of measure used to describe a control's physical value (after converting the logical value using the exponent value). The HID specification defines codes for the basic units of length, mass, time, temperature, current, and luminous intensity.

member.name: USAGE_PROPERTIES.exponent
member.summary: The value used to scale a logical value to a physical value.

member.name: USAGE_PROPERTIES.count
member.summary: The number of data items contained in the report.

member.name: USAGE_PROPERTIES.physicalMinimum
member.summary: The logicalMinimum expressed in physical units (converted by multiplying logicalMinimum by exponent).

member.name: USAGE_PROPERTIES.physicalMaximum
member.summary: The logicalMaximum expressed in physical units (converted by multiplying logicalMaximum by exponent).
